intro: Xylopia antunesii var. shirensis, commonly known as the Shirensis xylopia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Annonaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, woody stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by spherical, woody fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
